intro: Mendoncia cowanii var. cowanii, commonly known as the Cowan's mendoncia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native region.
